intro: Securidaca lophosoma, commonly known as the African senna, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to various regions across Africa, including South Africa, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces pods that contain seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features include small, trifoliate leaves and a distinctive, hairy stem. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
